What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 0-1 hours/week
0 Additional Hours
1 hour every other week.
N/A as this was a seminar series.
1hour lecture during lunch taught by various guest lecturers
There were no hours spent outside the classroom on this course.
N/A
1 hour
None

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I feel frustrated regarding the range of topics for the seminar, or lack thereof. You could guess who was organizing the talks just from the speakers that were brought in. I think student feedback would be really helpful in choosing speakers. There was a huge emphasis on the social side of social and behavioral science, and very limited speakers in behavioral science. I think many of us would appreciate if we had some say in it or if there could be a bigger range of topics covered
It was really cool to hear about work going on in the field and see opportunities for research and collaboration. Love it!
Nice presentation from researchers and professors.
Great opportunity to hear from professionals in the field of Chronic Disease Epidemiology.
I enjoyed the talks
Good for learning about research interests of CDE faculty members.
I thought the speakers who came to YSPH were really wonderful, and I thoroughly enjoyed the seminar series.
Interesting lectures - loved the one about Mexican Romances/Sexuality and the one on TransgenderHealth
Wonderful! Very interesting lectures.
This course hosted a nice range of seminar speakers.
good; would want better communication with students about guest speakers and their topics prior to session
It would be nice if it were better organized. Since it doesn't meet every week, it would be helpful to have an accurate schedule with all the talks ahead of time (even though they are all mandatory).
Good way to listen to professors from different schools talk about their work.
Seminars were thoughtfully presented. One suggestion I have would be to continue to promote the variability is topics.
Strengths- didn't meet very often, some pretty interesting speakers. Weaknesses- zero accountability as for whether we actually got anything out of the lectures, zero credit.
Great course! It was a little confusing as to which seminars were SBS required versus CDE required. If that can be conveyed clearly, it will be helpful.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?

Instructor: Danya Keene  Very kind
Instructor: Danya Keene  Great choice in lecturers!
Instructor: Danya Keene  Don't really know who this is
Instructor: John Pachankis  Good
Instructor: John Pachankis  Great choice in lecturers!
Instructor: John Pachankis  Was very considerate and open to suggestions for future seminars.
Instructor: John Pachankis  Gave nice introductions to speakers?
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Good
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Very kind
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Very excellent choice in speakers for this series! Great organization!
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Great choice in lecturers!
Instructor: Shiyi Wang  Don't really know who this is

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Interesting speakers and seminar series. Very limited in scope, and I feel behavioral sciences was underrepresented.
Recommend it
It's required but the content is narrowed and limited. I'd rather go Grand Rounds
Great opportunity to hear from professionals in the field of Chronic Disease Epidemiology.
Interesting seminars. I enjoyed learning about people's research within the field of public health. It was really neat and the food was good.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. I think this seminar series was a great way for the SBS and CDE tracks to come together and learn more about current research and practice that is going on within the field.
Loved it - free food and interesting talks!

This course brings in speakers from the field of public health to discuss their research and answer questions from students. It is a wonderful way to learn about some of the research that is happening in the field of public health today.

This course hosts speakers that present on a wide-range of public health topics. I would definitely recommend attending the seminars. Speakers come from around the country to discuss their research. Additionally, it provides an intimate environment to connect with speakers.
Was a nice opportunity to hear very interesting projects and topics
It was a great opportunity to be exposed to so many different fields of research and study
Overall the seminars presented a range of topics and current research related to fields we're studying.
Not the worst way to spend Thursday afternoons. Make sure you show up early for food.
Great topics and lectures. I would recommend.
